ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This class will tweak the excessive liberalism of our field and grant an opportunity to gain a new understanding ofsecurity and historical transitions in the international political and military framework.

It is a great course for those who want a general overview of recent world history from a balance of power perspective. I would recommend it to any student who does not already have a strong background in the field.

Yes, I would definitely recommend this class. In fact, it should be required for those pursuing certificates in international security studies. This class covers fundamental theories and history relevant to IR.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It allowed me to tweak my liberalist perspectives on International Relations with a valuable and much needed dose of realism.
I'm focusing on the international security implications of China's rise, and so this class was of direct relevance. It gave me insight on how China fits into the current balance of power.
